title: Domain search V.2
description: Enter a domain name and Snov.io will return all the email addresses on the domain.If there is any additional information about the email owner available in the database, we will add it as well.Each response returns up to 100 emails. If it does not return at least one email, you will not be charged for the request.

inputParameters.name: domain
inputParameters.description: The name of the domain from which you want to find the email addresses. For example, "snov.io".

inputParameters.name: type
inputParameters.description: It can contain different values - all ,personal or generic . A generic email address is a role-based email address, for example -contact@snov.io.A personal email address is the email of the actual person working at the company.

inputParameters.name: limit
inputParameters.description: Set the limit to specify the number of email addresses to return. Each response returns up to 100 email addresses.

inputParameters.name: lastId
inputParameters.description: To collect more emails than is set in your Limit input parameter, in your next request indicate the id of the last collected email address from the previous request. This way, previously collected emails will be skipped.Note that lastId is a required parameter.The default value is 0 .

inputParameters.name: positions
inputParameters.description: Use this parameter to filter prospects by job position, for example, "Software Developer". To filter by multiple positions, input an array of neccessary positions.

outputParameters.name: domain
outputParameters.description: The domain name for which the API has provided the email addresses.

outputParameters.name: webmail
outputParameters.description: Is true if the domain you`re searching is webmail.

outputParameters.name: result
outputParameters.description: The number of email addresses we have found for this domain. We can`t provide results for webmail domains, so the result for webmail will always be 0 .

outputParameters.name: limit
outputParameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of email addresses to return.

outputParameters.name: companyName
outputParameters.description: The company name used to find the email addresses.

outputParameters.name: emails
outputParameters.description: The array of domain emails retrieved in the search.

outputParameters.name: email
outputParameters.description: A specific email address retrieved in the search.

outputParameters.name: type
outputParameters.description: Can contain prospect or email values. If the returned type is prospect , Snov.io found additional information about the email owner.

outputParameters.name: status
outputParameters.description: Email`s verification status. Email`s status can be verified or notVerified.

outputParameters.name: firstName
outputParameters.description: The email owner`s first name.

outputParameters.name: lastName
outputParameters.description: The email owner`s last name.

outputParameters.name: position
outputParameters.description: The email owner`s current job position.

outputParameters.name: sourcePage
outputParameters.description: The source page of retrieved personal data.

outputParameters.name: lastId
outputParameters.description: ID of the last collected email from the previous response.

title: Email count
description: With this API method, you can find out the number of email addresses from a certain domain in our database. It`s completely free, so you don`t need credits to use it!

inputParameters.name: domain
inputParameters.description: The name of the domain for which you`d like to know the number of emails in our database.

outputParameters.name: domain
outputParameters.description: The name of the domain for which you`d like to know the number of emails in our database.

outputParameters.name: webmail
outputParameters.description: Is true if the domain you`re searching is webmail.

outputParameters.name: result
outputParameters.description: A total number of email addresses we have found for this domain. We can`t provide results for webmail domains, so the result for webmail will always be 0 .

title: Email Finder
description: This API method finds email addresses using the person`s first and last name, and a domain name. If we don`t have this email address in our database, we won`t be able to provide the results to you right away. To speed up the process, you can use the Add Names To Find Emails method to push this email address for search. After that, try the Email Finder method again.

inputParameters.name: firstName
inputParameters.description: The email address owner`s first name.

inputParameters.name: lastName
inputParameters.description: The email address owner`s last name.

inputParameters.name: domain
inputParameters.description: The domain name of the company that is used in the email address.

outputParameters.name: status
outputParameters.description: Use the values in this object to detect the status of the process.

outputParameters.name: identifier
outputParameters.description: Can contain the following values: complete ,in_progress , or not_found . If the identifier is not_found , the response will contain an empty array of emails.

outputParameters.name: description
outputParameters.description: Here you will see a text description of the email finding status.

outputParameters.name: data
outputParameters.description: Contains the search result.

outputParameters.name: firstName
outputParameters.description: The email address owner`s first name.

outputParameters.name: lastName
outputParameters.description: The email address owner`s last name.

outputParameters.name: emails
outputParameters.description: The array of email addresses with their statuses. Value emailStatus can contain: valid or unknown .

title: Add names to find emails
description: If Snov.io does not have the emails you are looking for in its database and can't provide these email addresses via the Email Finder, you can try to push the request for email search using this method. If an email is found, you can collect it by using the free Email Finder request again.

inputParameters.name: firstName
inputParameters.description: The email address owner`s first name.

inputParameters.name: lastName
inputParameters.description: The email address owner`s last name.

inputParameters.name: domain
inputParameters.description: The domain name of the company that is used in the email address.

title: Add URL to search for prospect
description: Find prospects by social URL. To receive the results, use the Get prospect with URL method.

inputParameters.name: url
inputParameters.description: A link to the prospect’s social media profile. Specify the name of the social network in the [brackets] (LinkedIn or X).

outputParameters.name: success
outputParameters.description: Is true if the prospect was successfully added to findlist.

outputParameters.name: message
outputParameters.description: There’s been an error in adding the prospect to the list.

title: Get prospect with URL
description: Provide the prospect's social URL and Snov.io will return the full information on the prospect with the found email addresses. You should previously use the Add URL to search for prospect method. Otherwise, the result will not be shown.

inputParameters.name: url
inputParameters.description: A link to the prospect’s social media profile. Specify the name of the social network in the [brackets] (LinkedIn or X).

outputParameters.name: success
outputParameters.description: Is true if the prospect was found

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: Unique profile identifier

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s full name

outputParameters.name: firstName
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s first name

outputParameters.name: lastName
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s last name

outputParameters.name: industry
outputParameters.description: Industry as indicated in the prospect’s profile

outputParameters.name: country
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s country

outputParameters.name: locality
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s locality

outputParameters.name: skills
outputParameters.description: Prospect's skills

outputParameters.name: social
outputParameters.description: Links to prospect’s social profiles

outputParameters.name: currentJobs
outputParameters.description: Array contains information about the prospect’s current job title

outputParameters.name: previousJobs
outputParameters.description: Array contains information about the prospect’s previous job titles

outputParameters.name: lastUpdateDate
outputParameters.description: Date of last profile update

outputParameters.name: emails
outputParameters.description: Prospect's email with actual status

title: Get profile with email
description: Provide an email address and Snov.io will return all the profile information connected to the provided email address owner from the database.If we find no information about the email owner in our database, you will not be charged for the request.

inputParameters.name: email
inputParameters.description: The email address of the person you want to find additional information on.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: A unique profile identifier.

outputParameters.name: source
outputParameters.description: The source of retrieved personal data.

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: The email address owner`s full name.

outputParameters.name: firstName
outputParameters.description: The person`s first name.

outputParameters.name: lastName
outputParameters.description: The person`s last name.

outputParameters.name: logo
outputParameters.description: The person`s profile photo.

outputParameters.name: industry
outputParameters.description: The person`s industry as indicated in the source.

outputParameters.name: country
outputParameters.description: The person`s country as indicated in the source.

outputParameters.name: locality
outputParameters.description: The person`s locality as indicated in the source.

outputParameters.name: social
outputParameters.description: Links to the person`s social profiles.

outputParameters.name: currentJobs
outputParameters.description: An array containing information about the person`s current job position(s).

outputParameters.name: previousJobs
outputParameters.description: An array containing information about the person`s previous job position(s).

outputParameters.name: lastUpdateDate
outputParameters.description: The date of the last profile update in the database.

title: Email Verifier
description: Check if the provided email addresses are valid and deliverable. API endpoint will return the email verification results. If we haven’t verified a certain email address before, the results will not be returned to you. In this case, the API will return a “not_verified” identifier and you will not be charged credits for this email. You should use the Add emails for verification method to push this email address for verification, after which you will be able to get the email verification results using this endpoint. This method will return data for each requested email address. The response contains an email verification status and verification results.

inputParameters.name: emails
inputParameters.description: The email addresses you need to verify.

outputParameters.name: status
outputParameters.description: The Email verification status. Contains identifier and description.

outputParameters.name: identifier
outputParameters.description: Can contain the following values: complete ,in_progress , or not_verified . If the identifier is not_verified ,data will be empty.

outputParameters.name: description
outputParameters.description: Here you will see a text description of the verification status.

outputParameters.name: data
outputParameters.description: Contains further verification results - email ,isValidFormat ,isWebmail ,isGibberish ,isCatchall ,isGreylist ,isBannedError ,isConnectionError .

outputParameters.name: email
outputParameters.description: The email address that has been verified.

outputParameters.name: isValidFormat
outputParameters.description: Is true if the format of email is correct, i.e. it contains valid symbols in the correct order.

outputParameters.name: isDisposable
outputParameters.description: Is true if we find that this email address is from a disposable email service.

outputParameters.name: isWebmail
outputParameters.description: Is true if this email address is from a webmail.

outputParameters.name: isGibberish
outputParameters.description: Is true if this email address has been automatically generated.

outputParameters.name: smtpStatus
outputParameters.description: Can return valid ,not_valid ,greylisted or unknown (aka Unverifiable). You can learn more about email statuses here.

outputParameters.name: isCatchall
outputParameters.description: Is true if the email belongs to an email server with a catch-all configuration, meaning it accepts emails even if the recipient is inactive or nonexistent.

outputParameters.name: isGreylist
outputParameters.description: Is true if the domain server employs greylisting technology and blocks our attempts to verify the email even when we use bypassing methods.

outputParameters.name: isBannedError
outputParameters.description: Is true when we cannot get a response from the server to our connection request.

outputParameters.name: isConnectionError
outputParameters.description: Is true when an error occurs on a client's server side during our attempt to establish a connection.

title: Add emails for verification
description: If you've never verified a certain email address before, you should push it for verification using this API method. After performing this action, you can receive the verification results using the Email Verifier.

inputParameters.name: emails
inputParameters.description: A list of email addresses you need to add to the verification queue. Each request can contain up to 10 emails.

title: Change recipient’s status
description: Change the status of a recipient in a specific campaign.

inputParameters.name: email
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s email address.

inputParameters.name: campaign_id
inputParameters.description: The campaign’s id. You can find it in the URL when you view the campaign info (show an example).

inputParameters.name: status
inputParameters.description: New status for the recipient. Can contain Active, Paused, Finished, Unsubscribed, Auto-replied, Replied, Replied from another email. You can not change the recipients' status if their status is Finished or Moved.

title: See list of completed prospects
description: This method returns prospects for whom the campaign has been completed.

inputParameters.name: campaignId
inputParameters.description: Сampaign's unique identifier to retrieve the prospects list.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: Request's unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: prospectId
outputParameters.description: Prospect's unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: userName
outputParameters.description: Prospect's full name.

outputParameters.name: userEmail
outputParameters.description: Prospect's email address.

outputParameters.name: campaign
outputParameters.description: Campaign name.

title: See campaign replies
description: This method returns the campaign replies with all the information, including the prospect’s name, ID, campaign, etc.

inputParameters.name: campaignId
inputParameters.description: Unique identifier of the campaign you want to view replies from.

outputParameters.name: campaignId
outputParameters.description: Campaign's unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: campaign
outputParameters.description: Campaign name.

outputParameters.name: prospectName
outputParameters.description: Prospect's full name.

outputParameters.name: emailSubject
outputParameters.description: Subject line of the email that received a reply.

outputParameters.name: emailBody
outputParameters.description: Contents of the email that received a reply.

title: Get info about campaign opens
description: This method shows the information about the opened emails in the campaign.

inputParameters.name: campaignId
inputParameters.description: Unique identifier of the campaign for which you want to view information about email opens.

outputParameters.name: campaignId
outputParameters.description: Campaign's unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: campaign
outputParameters.description: Campaign name.

outputParameters.name: prospectName
outputParameters.description: Full name of the prospect that opened an email.

outputParameters.name: emailSubject
outputParameters.description: Subject line of the email that was opened.

outputParameters.name: visitedAt
outputParameters.description: Exact time the prospect opened the email.

title: Check link clicks
description: This method returns information on all campaign recipients that have clicked a link in one of campaign emails.

inputParameters.name: campaignId
inputParameters.description: Unique identifier of the campaign you want to view link clicks for.

outputParameters.name: campaignId
outputParameters.description: Campaign's unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: campaign
outputParameters.description: Campaign name.

outputParameters.name: prospectName
outputParameters.description: Full name of the prospect that clicked a link from an email in the campaign.

outputParameters.name: prospectEmail
outputParameters.description: Prospect's email address.

outputParameters.name: emailSubject
outputParameters.description: Subject line of the email that contained a clicked link.

outputParameters.name: emailBody
outputParameters.description: Contents of the email.

outputParameters.name: visitedAt
outputParameters.description: Exact time the prospect clicked a link in the email.

title: View sent emails
description: This method shows the information about sent emails in the campaign.

inputParameters.name: campaignId
inputParameters.description: Unique identifier of the campaign for which you want to see sent emails.

outputParameters.name: sentDate
outputParameters.description: Exact time that the email was sent.

outputParameters.name: userName
outputParameters.description: Full name of the prospect that the email was sent to.

outputParameters.name: userEmail
outputParameters.description: Prospect's email address.

outputParameters.name: campaign
outputParameters.description: Campaign name.

title: View all campaigns
description: This method shows the list of all user campaigns.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: Unique identifier of the user's campaign.

outputParameters.name: campaign
outputParameters.description: Campaign name.

outputParameters.name: list_id
outputParameters.description: Unique identifier of the prospect list used in the campaign.

outputParameters.name: status
outputParameters.description: Campaign status.

outputParameters.name: created_at
outputParameters.description: Campaign creation date and time in the format of Unix Timestamp.

outputParameters.name: updated_at
outputParameters.description: Last campaign update date and time in the format of Unix Timestamp.

outputParameters.name: started_at
outputParameters.description: Campaign launch date and time in the format of Unix Timestamp.

title: Add to Do-not-email List
description: Using this method you can add an email or a domain to your Do-not-email List. After this email/domain has been added to the list, you won't be able to send emails to it.

inputParameters.name: items
inputParameters.description: Email or domain you want to add to your Do-not-email List.

inputParameters.name: listId
inputParameters.description: The Do-not-email List identifier that emails and domains belong to.

outputParameters.name: duplicates
outputParameters.description: This parameter shows which emails/domains have previously been added to the Do-not-email List.

title: Add prospect to list
description: Add prospect to a specific list. This method will be useful for those who want to automate adding prospects to lists with active email drip campaigns. This way after a prospect is automatically added to a chosen list, an email drip campaign will be started for them automatically.

inputParameters.name: email
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s email address.

inputParameters.name: fullName
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s full name.

inputParameters.name: firstName
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s first name.

inputParameters.name: lastName
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s last name.

inputParameters.name: phones
inputParameters.description: Array with prospect's phone numbers.

inputParameters.name: country
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s country. The country names are defined here. Please, only use countries from this list.

inputParameters.name: locality
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s locality.

inputParameters.name: position
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s job title.

inputParameters.name: companyName
inputParameters.description: The name of the prospect’s company.

inputParameters.name: companySite
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s company website. Please, use the http://example.com format.

inputParameters.name: updateContact
inputParameters.description: Updates an existing prospect. Can contain true , or false . If true and a prospect with this email address already exists in one of the lists, the system will update the existing profile. If false , the system will not update the existing profile.

inputParameters.name: customFields[specialization]
inputParameters.description: You can add custom values into previously created custom fields. To do this specify the name of the custom field in the [brackets].

inputParameters.name: socialLinks[linkedIn]
inputParameters.description: A link to the prospect’s social media profile. Specify the name of the social network in the [brackets] (LinkedIn, Facebook, or X).

inputParameters.name: listId
inputParameters.description: The identifier of the list the prospect belongs to.

outputParameters.name: success
outputParameters.description: Is true if the prospect was successfully added to the list.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: Added prospect’s identifier.

outputParameters.name: added
outputParameters.description: Is true if the prospect was added to the list.

outputParameters.name: updated
outputParameters.description: Is true if the existing prospect’s data has been updated.

outputParameters.name: errors
outputParameters.description: There’s been an error in adding the prospect to the list.

title: Find prospect by ID
description: Find prospects from your lists by id. Knowing the id of a specific prospect you can get full information on the prospect, including the lists and campaigns they’ve been added to.

inputParameters.name: id
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s id. You can see it in the response when you add a prospect via Add prospect to list API method or in the URL when you view prospect’s page (see an example).

outputParameters.name: success
outputParameters.description: Is true if the prospect was found

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: Unique profile identifier

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s full name

outputParameters.name: firstName
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s first name

outputParameters.name: lastName
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s last name

outputParameters.name: industry
outputParameters.description: Industry as indicated in the prospect’s profile

outputParameters.name: country
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s country

outputParameters.name: locality
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s locality

outputParameters.name: social
outputParameters.description: Links to prospect’s social profiles

outputParameters.name: currentJobs
outputParameters.description: Array contains information about the prospect’s current job title

outputParameters.name: previousJobs
outputParameters.description: Array contains information about the prospect’s previous job titles

outputParameters.name: lastUpdateDate
outputParameters.description: Date of last profile update

outputParameters.name: lists
outputParameters.description: Lists that the prospect has been added to

outputParameters.name: campaigns
outputParameters.description: List of campaigns this prospect has been added to as a recipient. Contains short statistics such as status, number of sent messages, opens and replies.

title: Find prospect by email
description: Find prospect from your lists by email address. When you search by email, you receive a list of all prospects tied to this email address. Every element of the list contains full information on the prospect, including the lists and campaigns they’ve been added to.

inputParameters.name: email
inputParameters.description: The prospect’s email address.

outputParameters.name: success
outputParameters.description: Is true if the prospect was found

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: Unique profile identifier

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s full name

outputParameters.name: firstName
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s first name

outputParameters.name: lastName
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s last name

outputParameters.name: industry
outputParameters.description: Industry as indicated in the prospect’s profile

outputParameters.name: country
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s country

outputParameters.name: locality
outputParameters.description: Prospect’s locality

outputParameters.name: social
outputParameters.description: Links to prospect’s social profiles

outputParameters.name: currentJobs
outputParameters.description: Array contains information about the prospect’s current job title

outputParameters.name: previousJobs
outputParameters.description: Array contains information about the prospect’s previous job titles

outputParameters.name: lastUpdateDate
outputParameters.description: Date of last profile update

outputParameters.name: lists
outputParameters.description: Lists that the prospect has been added to

outputParameters.name: campaigns
outputParameters.description: List of campaigns this prospect has been added to as a recipient. Contains short statistics such as status, number of sent messages, opens and replies.

title: Find prospect’s custom fields
description: This method returns a list of all custom fields created by the user, including the fields’ name, whether the field is optional or required, and the field’s data type.

outputParameters.name: key
outputParameters.description: The field’s key in the customFields array.

outputParameters.name: label
outputParameters.description: The field’s name.

outputParameters.name: required
outputParameters.description: Is true if the custom field is required.

outputParameters.name: type
outputParameters.description: The custom field’s data type (string, number, or date).

title: See user lists
description: This method returns all lists created by the user. You can use this method to review lists that can be used for an email drip campaign.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: User’s list unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: List name

outputParameters.name: contacts
outputParameters.description: The number of prospects in the list.

outputParameters.name: isDeleted
outputParameters.description: List’s status. Is true if the list has been deleted.

outputParameters.name: creationDate
outputParameters.description: The date and time of list creation (includes date, time, and time zone info).

outputParameters.name: deleteDate
outputParameters.description: If the list has been deleted, contains the date and time of list deletion (includes date, time, and time zone info).

title: View prospects in list
description: This method returns all the data on prospects in a specific list, including prospect’s data like email addresses and their status.

inputParameters.name: listId
inputParameters.description: The list’s unique identifier.

inputParameters.name: page
inputParameters.description: You can choose on which page of the list you would like to begin your search. This field is optional.

inputParameters.name: perPage
inputParameters.description: You can choose on which page of the list you would like to end your search. This field is optional. Maximum value is 100.

outputParameters.name: list
outputParameters.description: An array with information about the list and the prospects in it.

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: The name of the list.

outputParameters.name: contacts
outputParameters.description: The number of prospects in the list.

outputParameters.name: creation_date
outputParameters.description: The date of list creation (includes date, time, and time zone info).

outputParameters.name: emailsCount
outputParameters.description: The number of emails in the list.

outputParameters.name: prospects
outputParameters.description: A list of prospects in the list.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: A prospect’s unique identifier.

outputParameters.name: name
outputParameters.description: A prospect’s full name.

outputParameters.name: emails
outputParameters.description: A list of emails belonging to the prospect.

title: Create new prospect list
description: Use this method to create new prospect lists in your account.

inputParameters.name: name
inputParameters.description: The name of the new prospect list.

outputParameters.name: id
outputParameters.description: The ID of the created prospect list.

title: Check user balance
description: Use this method to check your credit balance.

outputParameters.name: balance
outputParameters.description: User’s current balance in credits.

outputParameters.name: teamwork
outputParameters.description: Is true if you are currently a team member or leader, false if you are not a part of a team.

outputParameters.name: recipients_used
outputParameters.description: Number of unique recipients used this month.

outputParameters.name: limit_resets_in
outputParameters.description: Days till the limit reset.

outputParameters.name: expires_in
outputParameters.description: Days till the end of subscription.
